main event: An unidentified bright white light was observed in the sky over Kotzebue, Alaska, on December 29, 1954.
interesting points: The light was as brilliant as a number 22 photographic flashbulb fired from a distance of 25 feet, and had a bluish-white color.
The light flash lasted for 10 seconds, but was followed by a white vapor trail that remained visible for 15 minutes.
The light traveled a 100-degree arc in 10 seconds at an estimated speed of 650-750 mph and an altitude of 20,000 feet.
The sighting was made by two civilian witnesses - a pastor and a reindeer herder - who were traveling by dog sled.
Despite investigations, the light remained unidentified, though it was possibly a meteor observation.
witnesses: a pastor and a reindeer herder
